error_in_repository_query_for_branches_d: The branch information of this repository could not be loaded.
missing_smeagol_plugin: Failed to fetch repositories. It's likely that the SCM-Manager is missing the plugin Smeagol Integration.
wikiroot_not_found_prefix: The requested Wiki could not be found. This could have several reasons:
wikiroot_not_found_reason_no_repository: There is no repository for the wiki on the target repository server
wikiroot_not_found_reason_wrong_type: The repository is not a Git repository
wikiroot_not_found_reason_permissions: You don't have access to the repository
wikiroot_not_found_reason_missing_conf: The repository does not contain a .smeagol.yml file
init-wiki-note_description: Initializes a wiki by adding a basic '.smeagol.yml' file to the current branch of the repository.
page-editor_no_write_permissions: You have not enough permission to edit this page
delete-confirm_text: Do you really want to delete the page?
general-information_welcome: Welcome to Smeagol, the repository documentation wiki.
general-information_description: Below you see a list of all Git repositories on your repository server that you have access to. If you want to write documentation for a repository you simply have to add a .smeagol.yml file to the root of the repository. Once that is done you can use the wiki. Whenever you save changes to a wiki Smeagol pushes them to the repository. This way the documentation is always up-to-date and where it belongs - close to the code!.
